description: English is a global language widely used for international communication, business, and travel.
Spanish is a Romance language spoken by millions around the world, particularly in Latin America and Spain.
French is spoken across many continents, with a rich history in culture, philosophy, and diplomacy.
German is the most widely spoken language in Europe and is important for business and engineering fields.
Chinese, particularly Mandarin, is one of the most spoken languages globally and vital for business in China.
Japanese is the language of Japan, with unique writing systems and a rich cultural heritage.
Russian is an East Slavic language spoken in Russia and many other countries in Eastern Europe and Central Asia.
Arabic is a central Semitic language spoken across the Middle East and North Africa.
Portuguese is spoken in Portugal, Brazil, and several African countries, with a growing number of speakers worldwide.
Italian is the language of Italy, known for its influence on art, music, and food.
Korean is the language of South Korea and North Korea, with a unique script and rich cultural history.
Dutch is spoken in the Netherlands, Belgium, and Suriname, and is closely related to German and English.
Hindi is one of the official languages of India and is spoken by millions across the Indian subcontinent.
Turkish is spoken in Turkey and Cyprus, and is an important language for business in the region.
Swedish is the official language of Sweden and Finland, and itâ€™s known for its high quality of life.
Greek has a rich history, being the language of ancient philosophers and the basis for many English words.
Polish is the official language of Poland, known for its complex grammar and rich cultural heritage.
Romanian is a Romance language spoken in Romania and Moldova, with Latin roots and unique linguistic features.
Danish is spoken in Denmark and is known for its simplicity in sentence structure and pronunciation.
Finnish is known for its complex grammar and is spoken by millions in Finland.
